column1: #Text=# Mixture Proportion Estimation and PU Learning: A Modern Approach
#Text=This repository is the official implementation of [Mixture Proportion Estimation and PU Learning: A Modern Approach](https://arxiv.org/abs/2111.00980).

#Text=We also release implementation of relevant baselines for [MPE](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/acmi-lab/PU_learning/main/files/MPE.txt) and [PU learning](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/acmi-lab/PU_learning/main/files/PU_classification.txt).
#Text=If you find this repository useful or use this code in your research, please cite the following paper:
#Text=> Garg, S., Wu, Y., Smola, A., Balakrishnan, S., Lipton, Z. (2021).
#Text=Mixture Proportion Estimation and PU Learning: A Modern Approach. arxiv preprint  arXiv:2111.00980.
#Text=    title={Mixture Proportion Estimation and {PU} Learning: A Modern Approach},
#Text=    author={Garg, Saurabh and Wu, Yifan and Smola, Alex and Balakrishnan, Sivaraman and Lipton, Zachary},
#Text=    booktitle={Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)}
#Text=The code is written in Python and uses [PyTorch](https://pytorch.org/).
#Text=To install requirements, setup a conda enviornment using the following command:
#Text=`train.py` file is the main entry point for training the model and run the code with the following command:
#Text=Change the parameters to your liking and run the experiment.
#Text=For example, change dataset with varying --data-type and vary algorithm with varying --train-method.
#Text=We implement the BBE estimator in `estimator.py` and CVIR algorithm in `algorithm.py`.
#Text=We provide a set of scripts to run experiments.
#Text=We provide paper results in paper_results folder and the corresponding code for plots in plot_helper.
#Text=This repository is licensed under the terms of the [Apache-2.0 License](LICENSE).
#Text=For more details, refer to the accompanying NeurIPS 2021 paper (Spotlight): [Mixture Proportion Estimation and PU Learning: A Modern Approach](https://arxiv.org/abs/2111.00980).
#Text=If you have questions, please feel free to reach us at sgarg2@andrew.cmu.edu or open an issue.
